attributes.action: Mandate that, for all government business, where dates are represented numerically such representation will adhere to British Standard 8601.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Internationally, a number of conflicting notations have been used to represent dates, such as YY/MM/DD, DD/MM/YY and MM/DD/YY. BS 8601 and associated International (ISO-8601), European and US standards, now mandate use of YYYY-MM-DD as a globally accepted standard for the numerical representation of dates.

The Govt, as a representative of “The Working Party on Facilitation of International Trade Procedures“ signed a recommendation in 1988, “that Governments and international organizations accept and use, and promote the general acceptance of (ISO-8601) for expressing dates, whenever these data are to be used in international trade.” This petition, seeks to extend such recommendation to all UK Government business, including use in eGovt and its interface to the public.

With the proliferation of the Internet, increased exposure to the conflicting 'legacy' date formats will continue to cause confusion unless governments act to standardise. Our govt is in a position to take a lead.
